summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to JP Morgan Chase, demanding extensive financial records for two individuals, Tova Noel and Michael Thomas, for the period from January 1, 2019, onward. It includes a cover letter requesting confidentiality, a detailed rider specifying the records required, and administrative forms related to reimbursement under the Right to Financial Privacy Act. The subpoena is part of a criminal investigation into suspected violations of federal statutes including bribery and money laundering.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Signs the grand jury subpoena and cover letter as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, authorizing the demand for financial records.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: Individual whose financial records (bank accounts, credit cards, etc.) from JP Morgan Chase are being subpoenaed by the grand jury for the period from January 1, 2019.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: Individual whose financial records (bank accounts, credit cards, etc.) from JP Morgan Chase are being subpoenaed by the grand jury for the period from January 1, 2019.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is authorizing a grand jury subpoena for Noel's financial records as part of a criminal investigation.
Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is authorizing a grand jury subpoena for Thomas's financial records as part of a criminal investigation.
Both individuals are named as subjects of the same grand jury subpoena for their financial records from JP Morgan Chase for the same time period.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY issues a grand jury subpoena to JP Morgan Chase demanding financial records for Tova Noel and Michael Thomas.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: The subpoena commands JP Morgan Chase to appear before the grand jury at the U.S. Courthouse in Foley Square, though a personal appearance is not required if documents are produced to the FBI by that date.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
JP Morgan Chase National Subpoena Processing Center, 7610 West Washington Street, Indianapolis, IN 46231
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, New York, NY
26 Federal Plaza, New York, NY 10278 (FBI Office)
86 Chambers Street, New York, NY 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office Accounts Payable)
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an active federal grand jury criminal investigation into suspected violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 201 (bribery) and 1956 (money laundering).
The investigation is seeking all financial records from JP Morgan Chase for Tova Noel and Michael Thomas from January 1, 2019, onward, indicating a focus on recent financial activity.
The U.S. Attorney's Office explicitly requests that JP Morgan Chase not disclose the existence of the subpoena to the individuals or any third party to preserve the investigation's confidentiality.
The detailed rider demands a comprehensive range of records including checking/savings accounts, credit cards, loans, wire transfers, safe deposit boxes, and currency transaction reports.

The document includes administrative procedures for the financial institution to seek reimbursement for costs under the Right to Financial Privacy Act, applicable only for individuals or small partnerships.
